slickR in Bookdown: Rendering Canonical Interactive User Manuals Preface

slickR in Bookdown: Rendering Canonical Interactive User Manuals Metrum Research Group 2017-03-17 Preface slickR is a R package for creating carousels that can hold various object types. Images, iframes and htmlwidgets can be put into a carousel. We show an example of how this can be leveraged to view in a compact way help manuals for any library. The library we are using as an example is ggplot2. The help files of ggplot2 thankfully contain many examples and when they are all compiled can create a very long output. Using slickR we can capture all the plot outputs of a given function to a carousel thus keeping a canonic output structure. The help file in an Iframe The carousel with the outputs If the library you are compiling has other output formats such as xtables you can use texPreview to embed SVG outputs of LaTeX tables inside the gitbook.

Chapter building Using the utility files in the utils.R we point queryChapter to the relevant package and filter a pattern along a given field (attribute) of the help file (name, concept, title). This gives a data.frame of functions that meet the search criteria. We can then use this data.frame to create chapters for the gitbook using createChapter. In this example a file named 01-Figures.Rmd will be created with a uniform output, a section with the function as its name and three chunks: A function to create an iframe containing the function help file in html form itâ€™s like the output from calling ?geom_point in an Rstudio console. The script to run all the examples found in the help file A slick carousel with all the example plot outputs

Book building Building the gitbook is pretty straight forward. We want to source the buildChapters script for chapters we want to create (e.g. 01-Figures, 02-Tables, 03-Widgets) and render the gitbook. Using _bookdown.yml, _output.yml, and a Makefile we can compile the book chapters and then render the gitbook. The Makefile contains: loadUtils: R --vanilla -e '.libPaths("../script/lib");library("ggplot2");source("utils.R");source("buildChapters.R");warnings()' gitbook: Rscript --quiet _render.R "bookdown::gitbook" openBrowser: R --vanilla -e 'browseURL("../docs/index.html")'
